_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The ways in which the mendicants develop: Wishing to live for another day and night
Wishing to live for another day
Wishing to live for half a day
Wishing to live as long as it takes to eat a meal of almsfood
Wishing to live as long as it takes to eat half a meal of almsfood
Wishing to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls
Wishing to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful
Wishing to live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out
The types of mendicants who develop mind: Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live for a day and night
Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live for a day
Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live for half a day
Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live as long as it takes to eat a meal of almsfood
Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live as long as it takes to eat half a meal of almsfood
Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls
Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful
Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out
The types of mendicants who live neglige: Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live for a day and night, to live for a day, to live for half a day, to live as long as it takes to eat a meal of almsfood, to live as long as it takes to eat half a meal of almsfood, or to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls

Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful, or to live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out
